newsitem.title: CANADA: Air Canada sees record March for cargo.
newsitem.headline: Air Canada sees record March for cargo.

text.p: March proved to be the best month ever for cargo in Air Canada's history, with traffic and revenues substantially ahead of March 1996 levels, says cargo chief Bob Thomson.
With the month almost over, the airline's North Atlantic cargo traffic is up 22 percent to the same point in March 1996, Thomson said from Montreal.
With yields up three percent, that has translated into a 26 percent revenue improvement on the North Atlantic, Thomson told Reuters.
Transborder (Canada-U.S.) cargo revenues are up over 33 percent in March, with traffic up 18 percent, reflecting strong market conditions and further expansion of the airline's transborder network.
Cargo accounts for about 8.5 percent of Air Canada's revenues from scheduled air services.

A senior cargo official of rival Canadian Airlines International said the first quarter performance for cargo at that carrier has been "phenomenal" - well above 1996 levels and above 1997 projections, even though capacity is down slightly. -Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom Tel +44 171 542 7706 Fax:5017
